intro: Helipterum haigii, commonly known as the pink fairy daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. Helipterum haigii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
